STEBBS

Tip

  1. Need help? Please let us know in the SUEWS Community.

  2. Please report issues with the manual on GitHub Issues (or use Report Issue for This Page for page-specific feedback).

  3. Please cite SUEWS with proper information from our Zenodo page.

4.3.43. STEBBS#

STEBBS (Surface Temperature Energy Balance for Building Surfaces) model parameters.

Controls the building energy balance calculations including internal heating/cooling, building materials properties, and thermal behaviour.

Parameters:

WallInternalConvectionCoefficient#

Internal convection coefficient of walls [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

7.69

Default Description:

Default value calculated from the CIBSE GUIDE A, Table 3.47, Page 176

Range Description:

Value must be greater than zero.

RoofInternalConvectionCoefficient#

Internal convection coefficient of roof [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

10.0

InternalMassConvectionCoefficient#

Convection coefficient of internal mass [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

7.69

FloorInternalConvectionCoefficient#

Internal convection coefficient of ground floor [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

5.88

WindowInternalConvectionCoefficient#

Internal convection coefficient of windows [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

7.69

WallExternalConvectionCoefficient#

Initial external convection coefficient of walls and roof [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

25.0

RoofExternalConvectionCoefficient#

Initial external convection coefficient of roof [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

25.0

WindowExternalConvectionCoefficient#

Initial external convection coefficient of windows [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

25.0

GroundDepth#

Depth of external ground (deep soil) [m]

Unit:

m

Example:

0.0

ExternalGroundConductivity#

External ground thermal conductivity

Unit:

W m-1 K-1

Example:

0.0

MetabolicRate#

Metabolic rate of building occupants [W]

Unit:

W

Example:

0.0

LatentSensibleRatio#

Latent-to-sensible ratio of metabolic energy release of occupants [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

ApplianceRating#

Power demand of single appliance [W]

Unit:

W

Example:

0.0

HeatingSystemEfficiency#

Efficiency of space heating system [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

MaxCoolingPower#

Maximum power demand of cooling system [W]

Unit:

W

Example:

0.0

CoolingSystemCOP#

Coefficient of performance of cooling system [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

VentilationRate#

Ventilation rate (air changes per hour, ACH) [h-1]

Unit:

h-1

Example:

0.0

InitialOutdoorTemperature#

Initial outdoor temperature [degC]

Unit:

degC

Example:

0.0

InitialIndoorTemperature#

Initial indoor temperature [degC]

Unit:

degC

Example:

0.0

DeepSoilTemperature#

Initial deep soil temperature [degC]

Unit:

degC

Example:

10.0

WaterTankWallThickness#

Hot water tank wall thickness [m]

Unit:

m

Example:

0.01

MainsWaterTemperature#

Temperature of water coming into the water tank [degC]

Unit:

degC

Example:

0.0

WaterTankSurfaceArea#

Surface area of hot water tank cylinder [m2]

Unit:

m2

Example:

0.0

HotWaterHeatingSetpointTemperature#

Water tank setpoint temperature [degC]

Unit:

degC

Example:

60.0

HotWaterTankWallEmissivity#

Effective external wall emissivity of the hot water tank [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

DHWVesselWallThickness#

Hot water vessel wall thickness [m]

Unit:

m

Example:

0.005

DHWWaterVolume#

Volume of water held in use in building [m3]

Unit:

m3

Example:

0.05

Default Description:

Missing default explanation.

Range Description:

Missing range explanation.

DHWSurfaceArea#

Surface area of hot water in vessels in building [m2]

Unit:

m2

Example:

0.5

HotWaterFlowRate#

Hot water flow rate from tank to vessel [m3 s-1]

Unit:

m3 s-1

Example:

0.0

HotWaterFlowProfile#

Profile of hot water flow rate from tank to vessel [m3 s-1]

Unit:

m3 s-1

The HotWaterFlowProfile parameter group is defined by the Ten Minute Profile structure.

DHWSpecificHeatCapacity#

Specific heat capacity of hot water [J kg-1 K-1]

Unit:

J kg-1 K-1

Example:

4186.0

HotWaterTankSpecificHeatCapacity#

Specific heat capacity of hot water tank wall [J kg-1 K-1]

Unit:

J kg-1 K-1

Example:

500.0

DHWVesselSpecificHeatCapacity#

Specific heat capacity of vessels containing hot water in use in buildings [J kg-1 K-1]

Unit:

J kg-1 K-1

Example:

500.0

DHWDensity#

Density of hot water in use [kg m-3]

Unit:

kg m-3

Example:

1000.0

HotWaterTankWallDensity#

Density of hot water tank wall [kg m-3]

Unit:

kg m-3

Example:

2500.0

DHWVesselDensity#

Density of vessels containing hot water in use [kg m-3]

Unit:

kg m-3

Example:

2500.0

HotWaterTankBuildingWallViewFactor#

Water tank/vessel internal building wall/roof view factor [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

HotWaterTankInternalMassViewFactor#

Water tank/vessel building internal mass view factor [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

HotWaterTankWallConductivity#

Effective wall conductivity of the hot water tank [W m-1 K-1]

Unit:

W m-1 K-1

Example:

0.5

HotWaterTankInternalWallConvectionCoefficient#

Effective internal wall convection coefficient of the hot water tank [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

0.0

HotWaterTankExternalWallConvectionCoefficient#

Effective external wall convection coefficient of the hot water tank [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

0.0

DHWVesselWallConductivity#

Effective wall conductivity of the hot water tank [W m-1 K-1]

Unit:

W m-1 K-1

Example:

0.5

DHWVesselInternalWallConvectionCoefficient#

Effective internal wall convection coefficient of the vessels holding hot water in use in building [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

0.0

DHWVesselExternalWallConvectionCoefficient#

Effective external wall convection coefficient of the vessels holding hot water in use in building [W m-2 K-1]

Unit:

W m-2 K-1

Example:

0.0

DHWVesselWallEmissivity#

Effective external wall emissivity of hot water being used within building [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.9

HotWaterHeatingEfficiency#

Efficiency of hot water system [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

Example:

0.0

MinimumVolumeOfDHWinUse#

Minimum volume of hot water in use [m3]

Unit:

m3

Example:

0.0

MaximumVolumeOfDHWinUse#

Maximum volume of hot water in use [m3]. Default is arbitrary placeholder to be refined with validation.

Unit:

m3

Example:

100.0

ApplianceProfile#

10-minute profile of appliance usage factor in building [-]

Unit:

dimensionless

The ApplianceProfile parameter group is defined by the Ten Minute Profile structure.

ref#

The ref parameter group is defined by the Reference Info structure.
